summary: NYU와 Emory 대학의 연구에 따르면, 완전히 AI로 생성된 광고는 클릭률(CTR)을 19% 높이지만, 인간의 작업물을 AI로 수정한 광고는 성과가 저조했다. 특히 EU AI 법안 등 규제 준수를 위해 'AI 생성' 라벨을 부착할 경우 클릭률이 31.5% 급락하는 것으로 나타났다. 이는 투명성과 마케팅 성과 간의 충돌을 시사하며, 마케팅 전략이 수정(Modify)이 아닌 초기 생성(Create) 중심으로 가야 함을 제안한다.
text: Ask about this article… Search A new study from researchers at NYU and Emory University shows a stark divide in AI marketing performance. While ads created entirely by AI significantly boost click-through rates, attempts to merely tweak human work with AI fall flat. Most strikingly, labeling ads as AI-generated causes performance to plummet. The findings highlight a major gap between two approaches: ads built from scratch by AI ("Gen AI created") perform much better than those where AI simply edits existing human designs ("Gen AI modified"). In a field study on the Google Display Network (GDN), fully AI-generated ads achieved a 19 percent higher click-through rate (CTR) than the human control group. The GDN places banner ads across millions of websites, apps, and videos based on context. Ad By contrast, AI-modified ads—using features like inpainting to change backgrounds or faces—failed to show improvements and sometimes performed worse. Ad DEC_D_Incontent-1 Creative freedom drives results The researchers trace this back to "output constraints." While text AI often works better when editing existing copy, visual AI is the opposite. When modifying existing images, the model must adhere to strict guidelines. The study shows that such AI-modified ads are perceived by consumers as less realistic. This reduced realism has a negative impact on purchase intent. Ad If, on the other hand, the AI is generated from scratch, it can freely design visual dimensions such as composition, color, style and perspective. The analysis shows that such fully generated ads are easy to grasp at a glance and evoke stronger emotional engagement. The effect becomes stronger when the AI also creates the product packaging design. In the experiments, the combination of AI-generated ad and AI-designed packaging achieved the best values for purchase intent and click-through rate. This suggests that visual AI is most effective when it holistically designs new advertising media, including packaging. Ad DEC_D_Incontent-2 Transparency labels kill clicks The study's second major finding could have an even bigger impact on AI use in marketing. With the EU AI Act requiring clear markings for AI content, the authors tested how these labels actually affect performance. Ad The results reveal a direct conflict between transparency and sales: when ads were openly labeled as "AI-generated" or "AI-edited," performance tanked. In the field test, disclosing AI involvement dropped the click-through rate by about 31.5 percent compared to unlabeled human ads. Even with identical images, simply knowing AI created them caused consumers to rate the ads lower. These findings suggest marketing teams should use visual AI early on to generate complete concepts, rather than using it to fix human designs later. Last year, OpenAI outlined a vision of "AI First" marketing that extends far beyond content creation. The company sees new models as more than just tools for routine work, viewing them as strategic partners capable of complex analysis and long-term planning.
title: Telling consumers an ad is AI-generated cuts clicks by 31 percent, study finds
title_ko: 소비자에게 AI 생성 광고임을 알리면 클릭률 31% 감소, 연구 결과

IS_Analysis.Score_Commentary: 학계(NYU/Emory)의 연구로, AI 마케팅 효율성과 규제(라벨링) 간의 역설을 정량적으로 입증함. 기업의 전략 수립에 중요한 인사이트를 제공하나, 연구 발표 자체가 산업 구조를 즉시 변경하는 물리적 사건은 아님.

Inputs.PE/SE 선정이유: 연구를 직접 수행하고 발표한 주체인 대학들을 PE로 선정(Academic Research Tier 2 적용). 특정 기업을 공격하거나 협력하는 구조가 아니므로 SE는 None.

Signal.Rationale: 31.5%, 19% 등 구체적인 대조군 실험 수치와 EU AI Act 연계성이 명확함.

Utility.Rationale: 마케팅 실무자에게 즉각적인 전략 수정 근거를 제공하는 높은 효용성.

Fine_Adjustment.Reason: 규제와 수익성 사이의 딜레마를 구체적 숫자로 증명한 고품질 리포트.
